process_steps.name: Complaint Receipt and Registration
process_steps.description: Client complaint received through channel (phone, email, branch, web portal) and initial details captured in complaint management system
process_steps.rationale: FCA requires all complaints to be logged within 1 business day. Critical for regulatory reporting and SLA tracking.

process_steps.name: Complaint Classification and Categorization
process_steps.description: Complaint categorized by product type, issue type, and severity. Priority level assigned based on regulatory risk and client impact.
process_steps.rationale: FCA requires accurate categorization for regulatory reporting. Determines routing and handling approach.

process_steps.name: Initial Acknowledgment to Client
process_steps.description: Automated or manual acknowledgment sent to client confirming receipt, providing complaint reference number, and outlining expected resolution timeframe.
process_steps.rationale: FCA requires acknowledgment within 5 business days. Sets client expectations and demonstrates regulatory compliance.

process_steps.name: Complaint Assignment to Investigation Owner
process_steps.description: Complaint routed to relevant department (Lending, Cards, Operations, etc.) based on product and issue type. Investigation owner assigned.
process_steps.rationale: Ensures appropriate expertise handles investigation. Critical for timely resolution within SLA.

process_steps.name: Investigation and Evidence Gathering
process_steps.description: Investigation owner reviews complaint details, gathers evidence from systems, interviews staff if needed, and documents findings.
process_steps.rationale: Core of complaint handling. Must be thorough for fair resolution and audit trail.

process_steps.name: Root Cause Analysis
process_steps.description: Investigation owner identifies root cause of complaint - process failure, system issue, staff error, or client misunderstanding.
process_steps.rationale: Required for effective resolution and preventing recurrence. FCA expects root cause tracking.

process_steps.name: Resolution Proposal and Approval
process_steps.description: Investigation owner proposes resolution (redress, apology, explanation, process change). Escalated to manager for approval if financial redress or policy exception required.
process_steps.rationale: Ensures fair and consistent outcomes. Four-eyes principle for financial decisions.

process_steps.name: Final Response to Client
process_steps.description: Formal final response letter sent to client explaining investigation findings, resolution offered, and right to escalate to Financial Ombudsman Service.
process_steps.rationale: FCA requires final response within 8 weeks (or earlier if upheld). Must include specific regulatory wording.

process_steps.name: Client Acceptance/Escalation Tracking
process_steps.description: Client response tracked - accepted, rejected, or escalated to Financial Ombudsman. Status updated in system.
process_steps.rationale: FCA requires tracking of ombudsman referrals. Critical for performance metrics.

process_steps.name: Lessons Learned and Process Improvement
process_steps.description: Investigation owner documents lessons learned. Patterns analyzed monthly. Process improvements or training needs identified and actioned.
process_steps.rationale: FCA expects continuous improvement. Prevents complaint recurrence.

process_steps.name: Regulatory Reporting (Quarterly)
process_steps.description: Complaint statistics compiled and reported to FCA quarterly - volumes, categories, outcomes, redress paid, ombudsman referrals.
process_steps.rationale: FCA mandatory reporting requirement. Non-compliance results in fines.

process_steps.name: Management Information and Oversight
process_steps.description: Monthly MI reports produced for senior management showing complaint trends, SLA compliance, root causes, actions taken.
process_steps.rationale: Senior management oversight required by FCA. Enables proactive management.

process_exceptions.name: Duplicate Complaint
process_exceptions.description: Client submits same complaint through multiple channels or resubmits existing complaint
process_exceptions.trigger: Multiple entries with same client and issue
process_exceptions.impact: Medium - wastes time, risks duplicate responses, confuses SLA tracking
process_exceptions.handling: Check for duplicates, merge records, notify client of single reference

process_exceptions.name: SLA Breach - Investigation Delay
process_exceptions.description: Investigation cannot be completed within 30-day SLA due to complexity or resource constraints
process_exceptions.trigger: Approaching SLA deadline with investigation incomplete
process_exceptions.impact: High - regulatory breach, client dissatisfaction, ombudsman risk
process_exceptions.handling: Escalate to manager, send holding letter to client, extend deadline with justification

process_exceptions.name: Third-Party Involvement
process_exceptions.description: Complaint involves third-party provider (card scheme, insurance, investment manager) requiring external investigation
process_exceptions.impact: High - delays resolution, complex coordination, SLA pressure
process_exceptions.handling: Contact third party, track separately, update client on delays

process_exceptions.name: Vulnerable Customer
process_exceptions.description: Complainant identified as vulnerable (elderly, disabled, mental health, financial difficulty)
process_exceptions.trigger: Vulnerability flags in CRM or identified during contact
process_exceptions.impact: High - regulatory scrutiny, requires special handling, Consumer Duty obligations
process_exceptions.handling: Flag in system, adjust communication approach, assign experienced handler, expedite where appropriate

process_exceptions.name: Legal Action Threatened
process_exceptions.description: Client threatens or initiates legal action alongside complaint
process_exceptions.trigger: Client mentions solicitor or legal proceedings
process_exceptions.impact: High - involves legal team, changes response approach, potential cost
process_exceptions.handling: Notify legal team immediately, coordinate responses, careful documentation

process_exceptions.name: Systemic Issue Identified
process_exceptions.description: Complaint reveals systemic problem affecting multiple clients (e.g., system error, process failure)
process_exceptions.trigger: Pattern identified or single complaint reveals wider issue
process_exceptions.impact: Critical - may trigger mass redress, regulatory investigation, reputational damage
process_exceptions.handling: Escalate to senior management and compliance, investigate scope, proactive client contact, regulatory notification if required

pain_points.name: Manual Data Entry and Duplication
pain_points.description: Complaint details manually entered into ServiceNow from emails, call notes, or letters. Same information often re-entered into other systems.
pain_points.manifestation: Time wasted on data entry, transcription errors, inconsistent data quality
pain_points.root_cause: No integration between channels and complaint system. Email and phone systems not connected to ServiceNow.

pain_points.name: Lack of Automated Duplicate Detection
pain_points.description: No automated check for duplicate complaints. Staff manually search by client name before logging new complaint.
pain_points.manifestation: Duplicate complaints logged, wasted investigation effort, conflicting responses sent to clients
pain_points.root_cause: ServiceNow not configured with duplicate detection rules. No unique client identifier used across channels.

pain_points.name: Slow Investigation Due to System Fragmentation
pain_points.description: Investigation requires accessing multiple systems (ServiceNow, Salesforce, banking platform, document storage). Evidence gathering is time-consuming.
pain_points.manifestation: Investigations take 2-5 days longer than needed. Staff frustration. SLA breaches.
pain_points.root_cause: No single view of client. Systems not integrated. Evidence scattered across platforms.

pain_points.name: Inadequate Root Cause Tracking
pain_points.description: Root cause captured as free text with no standardized categories. Difficult to analyze trends or identify systemic issues.
pain_points.manifestation: Cannot easily identify patterns. Systemic issues go undetected. Regulatory risk if FCA asks for root cause analysis.
pain_points.root_cause: No structured root cause taxonomy. Staff training inadequate. No validation rules in ServiceNow.

pain_points.name: Inconsistent Quality of Final Response Letters
pain_points.description: Final responses vary in quality. Some lack required regulatory wording. Some too technical, some too brief. No standard templates enforced.
pain_points.manifestation: Client confusion, increased ombudsman referrals, regulatory risk if wording non-compliant
pain_points.root_cause: No template library. No quality review before sending. Staff skill levels vary.

pain_points.name: Manual Regulatory Reporting Process
pain_points.description: Quarterly FCA report compiled manually by extracting data from ServiceNow, manipulating in Excel, and cross-checking with finance system for redress figures.
pain_points.manifestation: 2-3 days of manual effort per quarter. Error risk. Delays submission if issues found.
pain_points.root_cause: No automated reporting capability in ServiceNow. Data fields not aligned to FCA requirements.

pain_points.name: Limited Real-Time SLA Visibility
pain_points.description: SLA status not visible in real-time. Staff rely on daily report to identify at-risk cases. No proactive alerts.
pain_points.manifestation: SLA breaches discovered late. Reactive fire-fighting. Stress on staff. Client dissatisfaction.
pain_points.root_cause: ServiceNow not configured with SLA dashboard or alerts. No automated escalation workflow.

pain_points.name: No Systematic Lessons Learned Capture
pain_points.description: Lessons learned captured inconsistently. No structured process to ensure actions are tracked and completed.
pain_points.manifestation: Same issues recur. Improvement opportunities missed. FCA criticism of lack of continuous improvement.
pain_points.root_cause: No formal process. No accountability for action completion. No tracking tool.

controls.name: Complaint Registration Within 1 Business Day
controls.description: All complaints must be logged in ServiceNow within 1 business day of receipt

controls.name: Acknowledgment Letter SLA Control
controls.description: System tracks acknowledgment sent within 5 business days. Daily report identifies overdue cases.

controls.name: Four-Eyes Approval for Financial Redress
controls.description: Any complaint resolution involving financial redress over Â£500 requires manager approval before payment

controls.name: Final Response Letter Quality Check
controls.description: Sample of final response letters reviewed weekly by Complaints Manager to ensure quality and compliance

controls.name: 8-Week Final Response Deadline
controls.description: System tracks final response due date (8 weeks from receipt). Weekly report shows at-risk and overdue cases.

controls.name: Root Cause Documentation Requirement
controls.description: ServiceNow requires root cause field to be populated before complaint can be marked as resolved

controls.name: Vulnerable Customer Flag
controls.description: System checks for vulnerability flag from CRM. If present, complaint automatically escalated to senior handler and flagged for special care.

controls.name: Audit Trail Completeness
controls.description: All complaint actions and communications logged in ServiceNow. Monthly audit checks 20 random cases for complete audit trail.

controls.name: Quarterly Regulatory Reporting Deadline
controls.description: Quarterly report submission deadline tracked. Pre-submission quality check by Compliance Officer. Board attestation required.

controls.name: Management Oversight Meeting
controls.description: Monthly Complaints Committee meeting reviews MI, trends, breaches, actions. Minutes retained. Attended by Head of Customer Service, Compliance Officer, and relevant Heads of Department.

systems.name: ServiceNow
systems.purpose: Complaint management system - case tracking, workflow, reporting
systems.integration_points: Limited integration with email (manual import). No CRM integration.
systems.data_flows: Complaint data entered manually, workflow tracked, reports extracted to Excel

systems.name: Salesforce CRM
systems.purpose: Customer relationship management - client contact history, vulnerability flags, account details
systems.integration_points: No integration with ServiceNow. Staff access both systems separately.
systems.data_flows: Client data viewed during investigation, not automatically pulled into complaint record

systems.name: Email System (Outlook)
systems.purpose: Communication with clients - acknowledgments, final responses, ongoing correspondence
systems.integration_points: Emails manually saved to ServiceNow as attachments
systems.data_flows: Complaint emails received, manually logged. Response emails sent from template, copy saved to case.

systems.name: Power BI
systems.data_flows: Data pulled from ServiceNow, transformed in Power BI, dashboards published for management
